greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(1) = 10; a(n) = smallest number such that the juxtaposition a(1)a(2)...a(n) is a prime.
mathematica: a[1] = 10; a[n_] := a[n] = Block[{k = 1, c = IntegerDigits @ Table[ a[i], {i, n - 1}]}, While[ !PrimeQ[ FromDigits @ Flatten @ Append[c, IntegerDigits[k]]], k += 2]; k]; Table[ a[n], {n, 63}]
results.author: _Amarnath Murthy_, _Jason Earls_ and _Robert G. Wilson v_, Aug 05 2005
